name: folly
description:
Folly (acronymed loosely after Facebook Open Source Library) is a
library of C++11 components designed with practicality and efficiency in
mind. Folly contains a variety of core library components used
extensively at Facebook. In particular, it's often a dependency of
Facebook's other open source C++ efforts and place where those projects
can share code.

dependencies.name: m4
dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.

dependencies.name: autoconf
dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools

dependencies.name: automake
dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools

dependencies.name: libtool
dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.

dependencies.name: pkgconfig
dependencies.description:
pkg-config is a helper tool used when compiling applications and
libraries

dependencies.name: boost
dependencies.description:
Boost provides free peer-reviewed portable C++ source libraries,
emphasizing libraries that work well with the C++ Standard Library.
Boost libraries are intended to be widely useful, and usable across a
broad spectrum of applications. The Boost license encourages both
commercial and non-commercial use.

dependencies.name: gflags
dependencies.description:
The gflags package contains a C++ library that implements commandline
flags processing. It includes built-in support for standard types such
as string and the ability to define flags in the source file in which
they are used. Online documentation available at:
https://gflags.github.io/gflags/

dependencies.name: glog
dependencies.description: C++ implementation of the Google logging module.

dependencies.name: double-conversion
dependencies.description:
This project (double-conversion) provides binary-decimal and decimal-
binary routines for IEEE doubles. The library consists of efficient
conversion routines that have been extracted from the V8 JavaScript
engine. The code has been refactored and improved so that it can be used
more easily in other projects. There is extensive documentation in
src/double-conversion.h. Other examples can be found in
test/cctest/test-conversions.cc.

dependencies.name: libevent
dependencies.description:
The libevent API provides a mechanism to execute a callback function
when a specific event occurs on a file descriptor or after a timeout has
been reached. Furthermore, libevent also support callbacks due to
signals or regular timeouts.
